title: WHO IS THE GOAT MILKING CHAMPION?

subtasks: Wash the goat off
Take turns milking the teat with dominant hand
Compete to see who can milk faster
Measure milk squirted from each teat
Judge the winner based on volume
Check on the garden
Throw goat poop into the compost
Check on the chicken coop for eggs
Check the tire for eggs (as a backup)
Remember past garden experiences and successes
Check on the progress of unborn goats
Distinguish between which chicken is laying eggs (freak out chicken)
Ensure the favorite spots are shared fairly among chickens
Distribute mulberry leaves to chickens (but chickens may not take them)
Check the water source for ducks (potential contamination)
Feed the ducks mulberry leaves or other treats (but they might not like them)
Manage the interactions between different animals (e.g., keeping Penny away from Dora)
Command the dog to stay away from goats, sheep, and ducks
Praise the dog for obedience (e.g., "Good doggie")
Disperse the animals when needed

Take turns milking the teat with dominant hand
Compete to see who can milk faster
Measure milk squirted from each teat
Judge the winner based on volume
Check on the garden
Throw goat poop into the compost

Remember past garden experiences and successes

Check the water source for ducks (potential contamination)
Feed the ducks mulberry leaves or other treats (if they like it)
